title: The Near-Future of Regulatory Submissions: Embracing Reproducibility, Open Source, and Interactivity
text:

title: The Near-Future of Regulatory Submissions: Embracing Reproducibility, Open Source, and Interactivity
text:
Learning objectives
After a vision-filled motivational introduction, and through a succession of practical examples, this session will empower R developers, data scientists, and clinical researchers to adopt innovative, future-ready approaches.

title: The Near-Future of Regulatory Submissions: Embracing Reproducibility, Open Source, and Interactivity
text:
Is this course for me?
Ever wondered how clinical trials reporting may look in the future? Are you interested in learning about some of the latest tools and technologies transforming regulatory submissions? Do you want to explore the potential of R in clinical research? If you answered yes to any of these questions, this workshop is for you!
The workshop is not designed only for those who are masters in R. We will bring you along an intuitive path to produce reproducible (and interactive) reports.

title: The Near-Future of Regulatory Submissions: Embracing Reproducibility, Open Source, and Interactivity
text:
Prework
Before attending the workshop please check our posit cloud and create your own assignment. All packages needed are already installed there (it is a clone of the exercise folder).

title: The Near-Future of Regulatory Submissions: Embracing Reproducibility, Open Source, and Interactivity
text:
Main task: reporting clinical trials


Purpose of regulatory submissions is to show efficacy and safety of new drugs.

Deliver analysis reports, datasets, and software
Health Authorities (HA) need to be able to reproduce key results

title: The Near-Future of Regulatory Submissions: Embracing Reproducibility, Open Source, and Interactivity
section: Why migrate to R in Clinical Trials?
text:
Why migrate to R in Clinical Trials?
Benefits for all


Cost Efficiency: R is free, reducing software costs.
Flexibility: R offers greater customization and a vast package ecosystem.
Community Support and Collaboration: R has a large, active community driving rapid innovation.











Regulatory Submissions with NEST
